data.text: S1 E4: The establishment of the Umayyad caliphateâs capital in Damascus was the most important political turning point in early Muslim history. Trace the Umayyadsâ achievements, and investigate their reasons for locating the empireâs capital away from the Arabian peninsula, reflecting the shift from a religiously inspired Islamic empire to a politically oriented imperial power.
